title: Pete Alonso set to join Orioles with five year contract
snippets: First baseman Pete Alonso and the Baltimore Orioles are finalizing a five-year, $155 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan.
The Baltimore Orioles agreed to a five-year contract with free agent first baseman Pete Alonso. Alonso hit 264 home runs over his first seven seasons.

What the heck is a polar bear doing in Baltimore? Pete Alonso has agreed to a five-year, $155-million contract with the Orioles, ESPN‚Äôs Jeff Passan reported on Wednesday. The deal gives Alonso the highest average annual value ever for a first baseman. It is also the second richest contract ever handed out by the Orioles, trailing only Chris Davis‚Äôs $161-million deal signed in 2016. Alonso spent the first seven years of his career with the New York Mets. The Athletic ‚Äòs Will Sammon reported that New York was not comfortable matching the length and value of Alonso‚Äôs offer from the Orioles. In...

summary: Free agent first baseman Pete Alonso is finalizing a five-year, $155 million contract with the Baltimore Orioles, according to multiple reports. The deal gives Alonso the highest average annual value for a first baseman and is the second largest in Orioles history. Alonso, a five-time All-Star, spent his first seven MLB seasons with the New York Mets.
